description: Herbal aromas give a crisp character. The fruit is not entirely ripe, so the wine relies on its tannins and acidity to get balance.
title: Château Briot 2012  Bordeaux

description: This opens with off-putting aromas of cinnamon and air freshener. On the palate, this is chewy and creamy, with a ton of oak and jammy, baked berry flavors that finish sticky.
title: Bodega Carmine Granata 2011 Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Layers of mint and earth are slightly out of proportion in this leathery wine, the finish leaving a somewhat sour taste.
title: Muscardini 2011 Gracie Creek Vineyards Syrah (Sonoma Valley)

description: Aromas of chewable vitamins, apples and pine needles set up a plump, soft palate of bland, pithy grapefruit flavors.
title: Monterebro 2013 Blanco Sauvignon Blanc (Jumilla)

description: The wine is extracted and hard. It has a tough character along with some bitterness.
title: Château Penin 2012 Les Cailloux  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine is a mix of 85% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Petit Verdot and 5% Merlot that is tight, tannic and a tad green.
title: Charles Krug 2011 Yountville Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: A light and fruity wine that is ready to drink. From the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers region, it has red berry fruits and juicy acidity. A greener, herbal character in the background suggests grapes that weren't totally ripe at harvest.
title: Château de Crain 2012  Bordeaux

description: This is hard and tough, all tannins and extraction.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This tough wine seems light on fruit. It is hard and shows considerable extraction.
title: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Rough and rugged is the best way to describe this Malbec. Earthy, woody, rubbery berry aromas lead to a sharp, high-acid palate. Wiry, fiery plum-like flavors stay fierce and pick up heat on the finish.
title: Quara 2013 Estate Bottled Malbec (Cafayate)

description: Candied, dusty aromas turn sweet and soapy if given time. The sugary feel to the palate stops just short of cloying, while candied raspberry, watermelon and brown sugar flavors end with milk chocolate and sweet red-fruit notes.
title: Baja Tanga NV Sparkling Sec Cuvée Rosé Sparkling (Mendoza)

description: Leathery, rubbery aromas are pinched, stalky and unripe. This Patagonian blend is drawing and astringent, with bland, cool-climate red-berry flavors that have an herbal streak. Saucy, tannic and heavy on the finish, this ends with a note of salami and fennel.
title: Verum 2012 Los Cisnes Coalescence Red (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

description: Prickly, sweaty aromas include matchstick and herbaceous green-fruit notes. In the mouth, this is chunky yet citrusy. Flavors of grassy citrus trend toward green, while a pithy, citric finish is bitter.
title: Verum 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

description: Earthy, medicinal plum and berry aromas are also a bit mulchy and leathery in character. A disjointed, tannic palate brings dry oak, medicinal berry and green flavors. Chocolate rises up on the finish of this full bodied Monastrell.
title: Juan Gil 2013 Honoro Vera Monastrell (Jumilla)

description: This is a thin wine with way too much acidity for the fruit. The rest of the wine is dry tannin that could soften into a more juicy character. It's always going to be a light wine.
title: Léo de la Gaffelière 2012  Bordeaux

description: There's lots of rich blackberry, chocolate and currant flavor in this smooth, 100% varietal Cabernet. The tannin-acid balance is fine, giving the wine rich interest. Ready to drink now.
title: B&E; 2009 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: With solid berry and plum aromas, the bouquet is friendly and nice. This is fresh and fruity in style, with hints of leather and chocolate accenting core berry and plum flavors. An earthy, warm finish with leathery notes is the final act.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Bodegas Navarro López 2010 Premium 1904 Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Here is a steady and clean expression of Sangiovese that delivers steady pulses of cherry and oak spice with smaller doses of cola and licorice at the back. The wine is dark and concentrated with a touch of sourness in the mouth.
title: Umberto Cesari 2008 Riserva  (Sangiovese di Romagna)

description: It's all about ripe, jammy blackberries, cherries and dark chocolate in this soft, tannic Cabernet. The alcohol is noticeable for the heat it gives, and the finish is rich with glycerols. Drink soon.
title: Ideology Cellars 2009 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Mainly Cabernet Sauvignon, this complex wine offers layers of blackberries, black currants, blueberries and sweet oak. The tannins are smooth, and the acidity just fine. The overall impression is a little ripe and obvious in its appeals, but it does have a certain fanciness.
title: J. Lohr 2008 Cuvée PAU Red (Paso Robles)

description: This pretty expression of Pecorino opens with a fragrant bouquet of wild flower, stone fruit and sweet honey. The wine holds firmly to the palate thanks to the natural richness of this indigenous grape.
title: Caldora Vini 2011 Colle dei Venti Pecorino (Terre di Chieti)

description: This 60-40 blend of Sangiovese and Cabernet from Central Italy opens with a pretty quality of fruit that shows bold extraction and still-young tannins with an astringent bite at the end. The bouquet is characterized by red fruit, spice and leather.
title: Celli 2010 Bron & Rusèval Red (Romagna)

description: Full in style, this is a lemon-scented, peach-flavored wine. It has some richness to it both from the ripe fruit and the textured acidity that gives a tight tang to the aftertaste. The needs to age for a year. Screwcap.
title: Château La Rose du Pin 2012  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: A full and ripe rosé from the Sumeire family which owns a number of Provence estates. This wine has freshness along with its rich character, strawberry fruit and acidity well in balance.
title: Château la Tour de l'Evêque 2012 Pétale de Rosé Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Austere and firm, this is still many years from being ready to drink. For now, its potential is apparent in the juicy black fruits, dark tannins and solid structure. It has much of the structure of the vintage, well clothed in fuller fruits.
title: Château Lavergne-Dulong 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This Cab may be in a bit of a dip. It's awkward, with a sharp, edgy mouthfeel, and as the wine ages, raisin notes creep forward. Still, kudos to Ehret for holding the wine back for so long, as it does possess a certain complexity.
title: Ehret 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)

description: This is on the soft side for rosés, a warm wine with a sense of Mediterranean herbs and sun. It has light red fruits, spice and great final acidity.  Screwcap.
title: Estandon 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Fruity, light-hearted wine that pushes forward its red fruits, its crisp acidity and its bright texture. There is a dancing character to this delicious, refreshing wine.
title: Gassier 2012 Miradou en Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: There's lots of rich, jammy blackberry, cherry and oak flavor in this Merlot, with a gentle scour of firm tannins. It's not an ager, but offers plenty of upfront pleasure for drinking now.
title: Ghost Pines 2010 Winemaker's Blend Merlot (Sonoma County-Napa County)

description: The chocolate and black-cherry jam flavors are a little too heavy and rich, lacking zest and complexity. But there's no denying this Pinot is delicious to drink now.
title: Adelaida 2010 HMR Vineyard Pinot Noir (Paso Robles)

description: A bit on the brawny side of Pinot Noir, with jagged tannins and plenty of full-bodied cherry fruit. Not a bad wine, but lacking the delicacy of the 2008 and 2009 vintages.
title: Alta Maria 2010 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Lots of enjoyable cherry, currant, licorice and sandalwood flavors in this dry, crisp Pinot Noir. Firm tannins give it some toughness, but it doesn't seem to be an ager, so drink over the next 3–4 years.
title: August West 2011 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Shows a dry, acidic profile, with tantalizing raspberry and sour-cherry candy and sweet oak flavors. The mouthfeel is silky and delicate.
title: Babcock 2011 Psi Clone Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Was it the chilly vintage that made this wine so elusive? Tasted in the spring, it was oaky and jammy with raspberries and cherries, with the astringent tannins of green herb tea. Hard to tell where it's going, if anywhere, but it does have dryness and vital acidity in its favor.
title: Babcock 2011 Slice of Heaven Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Streppaticcio is 60-40 Montepulciano and Sangiovese with simple fruit tones followed by slight accents of white mushroom, crushed mineral, black olive and caper. It ends with smooth richness.
title: Barbi 2011 Streppaticcio Red (Umbria)

description: The first whiff of this Rioja is full of oaky char, shoe polish, raw leather and can't-miss wood resin. With airing the nose cedes chocolate and berry scents. This is plump, chewy and a touch resiny feeling on the palate, with baked berry, savory notes, grilled meat flavors and saltiness. A roasted, rubbery finish is apropos.
title: Bodegas Zugober 2010 Belezos  (Rioja)

description: Just bottled when tasted, this is a wine that needs a few months to come together. Its ripe pear and apricot fruit and dense flavor will offer a full, rounded wine that goes more for a tropical Sauvignon Blanc character.
title: Calvet 2012 Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: The 2010 Select is a step ahead of Torii Mor's single vineyard offerings, but holds to the common thread of hard, tart, tight wines with little flesh on their bones. Here the raspberry and strawberry fruit pokes through the herbs and tannins enough to warrant drinking sooner while waiting for the others to (possibly) soften up.
title: Torii Mor 2010 Dundee Hills Select Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Known for some of Italy's most beautiful sand beaches, you might not consider the resort area of Sabaudia (in the Lazio region) a farming area for Sauvignon grapes. Despite the disconnect, this wine brings together territory and variety with ripe aromas of exotic fruit, peach and subtle tones of seashell and sulphur.
title: Villa Gianna 2011 Vigne del Borgo Sauvignon (Lazio)

description: You'll find plenty of tart green gooseberries in this dry Sauvignon Blanc. Yet there are also ripe grapefruit, kiwi and papaya flavors. It's a refreshingly clean wine for drinking now.
title: Voss 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: This is a straightforward Merlot with herbal aromatics, oaky tannins and a layering of quiet raspberry and spice. Well priced for the quality and food-friendly nature of this wine.
title: Wente 2010 Sandstone Estate Merlot (Livermore Valley)

description: Tempting in raspberry, vanilla and spice, Wood's Clone 30 Cabernet Sauvignon is fully formed, rich, and slightly oaky with a finish of tobacco pipe.
title: Wood Family Vineyards 2010 Clone 30 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

description: An easy, delicious Pinot Noir, this is dry and brisk in acidity, with rich cherry, cola, cranberry and sweet oak flavors. The silky texture makes it especially drinkable now.
title: Woodenhead 2010 Wet Kiss Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Made at Provence classed growth Château Rimauresq, this soft and full rosé has attractive red and citrus fruits, a hint of pepper and herbs. It's warm and ready to drink.
title: Xavier Flouret 2012 Nationale 7 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Soft and easy, with ripe, fruity cherry jam, cassis, mocha and spice flavors. The tannins are strong, and may give the wine some ageability, but you're better off drinking it soon.
title: Hawks View 2010 Syrah (California)

description: Already one of Italy's most iconic bottlings, this gorgeous 2010 is already a classic. Its complex and intense bouquet unfolds with ripe blackberries, violets, leather, thyme and balsamic herbs. The palate shows structure, poise and complexity, delivering rich black currants, black cherry, licorice, mint and menthol notes alongside assertive but polished tannins and vibrant energy. This wine will age and develop for decades. Drink 2018–2040.
title: Marchesi Antinori 2010 Solaia Red (Toscana)

description: The wine shows the power typical of a Lafite but within the context of the fruity 2011 vintage. The immensely dense tannic structure gives the wine a solid feel that is lifted by so much ripe black currant and berry fruits. At the back, the wine has a more brooding, dark character that suggests great aging potential. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2011  Pauillac

description: So smooth, this is a rich, grandiose wine. Although it is full of black currant fruits and spice flavors, the texture is most impressive. Dusty tannins are integrated with juicy fruits seamlessly. The purest fruit flavors are allied to linear tannins in a precise yet generous way. The wine is evolving beautifully, but do not drink before 2020.
title: Château Pontet-Canet 2011  Pauillac

description: It opens with an enticing fragrance of black berries, toast, Mediterranean spices and a touch of vanilla. The vibrant, youthful palate delivers a core of black cherry accented with black pepper layered with mocha, mint and tobacco notes. The racy acidity and solid but brooding tannins demonstrate that this wine still needs time to develop to its extraordinary potential. Drink 2018–2035.
title: Isole e Olena 2010 Cepparello Sangiovese (Toscana)

description: Huge structure, huge potential, a wine that will bring out all the fruit and density of the vintage while remaining very fresh. Black plums are already showing strongly along with the dry core that promises aging. It's serious while alive and bright. Drink this major wine from 2022.
title: Château Léoville Las Cases 2011  Saint-Julien

description: This is a focused, riveting expression of Red Mountain Syrah from a great vineyard. It's packed with juicy flavors of fresh raspberries, tinged with tangerine-flavored acids. Elegant and fascinating, it's a pure, fruit-driven expression of the grape, bolstered by the natural minerality of Ciel du Cheval fruit.
title: Syncline 2011 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Syrah (Red Mountain)

description: This barrel-fermented Chardonnay, from the oldest plantings (1972) in Washington State, displays exceptional concentration and palate weight. Apple pie, pear tart, baking spice, butter and caramel flavors abound. It's rich and packed with fruit, along with the seductive flavors that aging in new French oak can provide.
title: Ashan 2012 Kestrel Vineyard Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

description: Rich aromas of late summer are here: the ripe peel of yellow pears, luscious peach and yellow Mirabelle plum plus some dried hayflower notes. There is power and depth, along with some alcoholic heat and balancing acidity—beautiful now but it will get even better. Drink until 2020.
title: Salomon-Undhof 2012 Alte Reben Berglagen Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

description: A solidly structured wine, it is both elegant and intensely powerful. It is disclosing its fruitiness slowly, at the moment dense and concentrated. A restrained edge provides complexity and balance. It will need aging, so don't drink before 2022.
title: Château Margaux 2011  Margaux

description: This iconic Brunello seamlessly combines power and finesse. It opens with earthy aromas of underbrush, tobacco, tilled soil and blackberries. The dense palate delivers juicy black cherry and raspberry alongside black pepper, licorice and a balsam note. It's impeccably balanced but still very young, and still showing racy acidity and assertive tannins. Give it time to soften and develop more complexity. Drink 2016–2031.
title: Col d'Orcia 2006 Poggio al Vento Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Made entirely from Sangiovese, it opens with fragrances that recall spicy black berries and Mediterranean herbs. The velvety palate delivers power and finesse along with fleshy black cherry, licorice and a graphite note. Wine Warehouse, Polaner Selections.
title: Felsina 2010 Fontalloro Sangiovese (Toscana)

description: Lifted ripeness and candied lemon peel send their aromas heavenwards. These rounded aromas with a fetching touch of bitter fir and honey also appear on the palate where acidity is present but cushioned. Like honey parfait spiked with lemon peel, this is lovely and lingers long.
title: Josef Jamek 2012 Ried Klaus Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

description: From the grandson of the inventor of Brunello, this iconic bottling opens with a classic bouquet of rose, violet, berry and spice. The vibrant palate delivers bright wild cherry, white pepper and energizing mineral notes along with impeccable balance and finesse. It's very elegant, with firm but supple tannins and still-nervous acidity. Give it time to unwind and develop complexity. Drink 2016–2038.
title: Biondi Santi 2008  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Demonstrating finesse and depth, it discloses a stunning fragrance of pressed rose, iris, berry, leather and truffle. The rich but elegant palate delivers creamy cherry, white pepper and licorice along with supple tannins. This wine already shows great depth but will continue to develop for years.
title: Giuseppe Cortese 2006 Rabajà Riserva  (Barbaresco)

description: The tightly closed nose only gives away a little ripe red apple. Even with the fruit locked underneath the stones, the sleek power, the impression of saltiness and lime-zest purity of this wine whisper promises. These will be kept, at least if you wait until 2017. This one will last and last.
title: Rudi Pichler 2012 Wösendorfer Kirchweg Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

description: Black berry, plum, red currant and cedar aromas take center stage in this fantastic vintage of one of Italy's most iconic wines. The structured, poised palate delivers a great depth of flavors that include succulent black cherry, cracked black pepper and mocha that are energized by a flinty mineral note. Smooth and balanced with polished tannins and fresh acidity, this is already delicious but hold for complexity. Drink 2015–2030.
title: Marchesi Antinori 2010 Tignanello Red (Toscana)

description: This wine has so many of the structural elements of a Saint-Estèphe, but also is enveloped by ripe fruitiness. Black in color and dense in character, it has sweetness from the plum juice fruits and great acidity. But it is also firm, powerfully projecting a serious potential. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Calon Ségur 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: There is a lightness about this vintage of Mouton Rothschild. It doesn't take away from its quality but does give the wine poise and an attractive lift. The wine is based on solid tannins, then the ripe fruit builds layers of fruitiness and freshness. It is not likely to be one of the longest-aging Moutons, but it will be delicious. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2011  Pauillac

description: Powdery notions of white peony petals against a stony background suggest concealed aromas that need time to come to the fore. Right now the palate is tight, with buffered acidity at the core, long, lean and promising. Lime zest lurks amid suspicions of ripe peaches in a sherbety, lemony sharpness. The wine will blossom as of 2017.
title: Rudi Pichler 2012 Wösendorfer Hochrain Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

description: Another impressive effort from the celebrated Ornellaia estate. it opens with aromas of black berries, plum, blue flower and hints of balsamic herbs. The rich palate delivers a core of fleshy black cherry accented with notes of licorice, black pepper and mocha alongside bracing but refined tannins. It's still young so give it time to fully develop. Drink 2016–2031.
title: Ornellaia 2011  Bolgheri Superiore

description: A spark of flint leaps out of the glass, followed by green plums and Conference pear. That stony touch also tempers the concentrated body and runs from start to pleasantly long finish, ending in a pleasantly bitter sting. Drink as of 2016.
title: Salomon-Undhof 2012 Von Stein Berglagen Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

description: Still shy but invitingly soft, it has a charming peachiness that cushions both the lemony acidity and the streak of stony minerality. Edges of mandarin peel and flesh add to the allure, which will increase with age. Softly-spoken but very convincing and long.
title: Hirsch 2012 Gaisberg Reserve Riesling (Kamptal)

description: Red-cheeked apples, juicy pear and Mirabelle plums comes out to play here, tightly held by brilliant acidity. The undertone of herbal savoriness is glimpsed and will come to the fore as this ages. Drink as of 2016.
title: Josef Jamek 2012 Ried Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

description: At this point subdued, this wine promises future pleasures with a ripe, rounded but precise character. Right now, it's citrus that shows, with ripe lemon zest and some grapefruit. Underneath riches of red apples, yellow peaches and apricots await. Purity and minerality are a bonus. This is a keeper; drink as of 2018.
title: Eichinger 2012 Heiligenstein Reserve Riesling (Kamptal)

description: Plump, ripe apricots play above a peppery, lemony core that bursts with juiciness and teases with salty minerality that keeps you wanting more. Delicious now, it promises lots of mileage. Drink until 2020.
title: Eichinger 2012 Lamm Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: Herbal touches of chervil and dill combine with grapefruit zest and a slender but muscular body. Shades of pepper spice are revealed on the tight palate that culminates in a long, delicious and savory finish. Drink as of 2016.
title: Jurtschitsch 2012 Loiserberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: While this is almost ready to drink, with its fruity pear and apple flavors, beneath the surface, the wine is much more serious. It has a rich feel to it, touched by toast and a hint of honey, it has a firm wood aging character, a firm structure and considerable potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2011 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a textural, bracing study in how to layer a Chardonnay. Green berries, apples, Asian pears, jicama, cucumber, wet stone and creamy lees flavors all combine seamlessly, placing the small percentage of wine aged in new oak in an appropriately light supporting role. Excellent length and perfect balance.
title: Lauren Ashton Cellars 2012 Reserve Chardonnay (Washington)

description: So light and delicate, this is a wine beautifully poised and balanced. It has liveliness, pepper apricot and a hint of honey. Still very young. Drink from 2017.
title: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2012 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

description: Soos Creek's value-priced Sundance Red really shines in 2010. A Bordeaux-style blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 31% Merlot and 19% Cabernet Franc, it rivals the top-tier efforts from any number of wineries. Plum, cherry, cassis and chocolate flavors are leavened with a dash of herb. Tannins are dusty and detailed, and the wine has the stuffing to age over the next half decade or more.
title: Soos Creek 2010 Sundance Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a wonderful edition to Pearl, Sparkman's 100% Sauvignon Blanc. It's vibrant and energetic, the kind of high-wire flavors more commonly found in Sancerre. Three days after it was first tasted, the wine was still drinking beautifully, with candied mixed fruits and terrific concentration.
title: Sparkman 2011 Pearl Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a beautiful Cabernet that's soft, subtle and delicious. It has balanced blackberry, plum and licorice flavors, touched with oak, and finishes with low-alcohol elegance.
title: Cameron Hughes 2010 Lot 363 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This is the softest of the three single vineyard wines from Château de Fuissé. It has a warm, rich character, generous and full in the mouth. Yellow fruits are partnered with citrus acidity and an attractive layer of wood. The wine ends with the freshness of the vintage.
title: Château Fuissé 2011 Le Clos  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Pretty raspberries, red currant and a hint of iodine spark the taste buds, then darker streaks of wood smoke and black licorice kick in. There's snappy acidity and an undertone of metal and stone. Complex and captivating.
title: Januik 2010 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Syrah (Red Mountain)

description: On the sweet side, this is a rich, almost honeyed wine. It has deliciously ripe fruit, lychees and fragrant lemon. Full and generous, the wine still manages to keep some good freshness. It is young, so drink from 2017.
title: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2011 Zotzenberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: From the Ferrington and Monument Tree Vineyards, the latter now owned by Twomey, this delicate Pinot has an aura of baked bread on the nose followed by just-ripe Bing cherry. With firm tannins and a subtle texture, it is a delight to drink and to pair. You couldn't go wrong with a pork roast swaddled in mushrooms.
title: Twomey 2011 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This delicious Amarone offers intense aromas of plum and spice. The palate delivers ripe black cherry and raisin flavors, layered with accents of chocolate, white pepper, licorice and almond. It already has fantastic depth and should gain more complexity over the next few years.
title: David Sterza 2009  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Plum and raspberry aromas come with a spicy topping and distant notes of dried cheese and leather. This feels fresh and feminine on the palate, where dry plum and cherry flavors come with hints of vanilla, loam and cocoa. A smooth finish with tea notes is finely composed and elegant. Drink through 2019.
title: Finca Mayor 2004 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Enormously rich, showing cola, black cherry pie filling and even some dark chocolate notes. There's a soft sweetness of fruit and oak that suggests drinking this lovely wine now. You can't go wrong with a grilled steak, or carne asada.
title: Foxen 2011 Julia's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A perfumed wine from new wood aging, powerful extraction and dark tannins. The wine is dense and black in color, heavy on the ripe berry and plum fruits with very firm structure. With its power and youthful fruit, it will age well. Don't drink before 2018.
designation: Cuvée Icône du Château Leret Monpezat
title: Georges Vigouroux 2010 Cuvée Icône du Château Leret Monpezat Malbec (Cahors)

description: Goldeneye's estate-grown Pinot, much of it from Gowan Creek Vineyard, this wine is intended to be the best blend from the best barrels. Powerful, with a ripe mouthful of blueberry, it is framed well by oak, giving it a roasted quality and suggestion of forest floor.
title: Goldeneye 2010 Ten Degrees Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: A sure-fire crowd-pleaser, this tightly-wound Merlot comes on very Cab-like, but with red fruits more than blue or black. It opens up into a broad mid-palate, showing well-balanced nuances of olive and earth, fresh herb, pepper and licorice. Dense, textural and smoky, it's delicious now or could be cellared for another five or six years.
title: Januik 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Big, bold and rich wine, solidly tannic, firm and ripe. Vivid black plum flavors scroll across the palate giving a full, firm, right up front feel. The wine has great texture, weight and density. It also has an impressive future, so drink from 2017.
title: Jean-Luc Baldès 2011 Clos Triguedina Probus Malbec (Cahors)

description: This is 95% Syrah, co-fermented with Viognier in the Northern Rhône style. The result is a very fine wine that is currently drinking quite young and tight. It's shut down in hard tannins and an immature reticence of fruit, although you can detect some ripe, delicious blackberries, plums, currants and dark chocolate. Give it 5–6 years in a good cellar.
title: Keller Estate 2010 Rôtie Red (Sonoma Coast)

description: This little gem is sourced entirely from the Klipsun Vineyard, and it's the sort of wine that will wake up the sleepiest palate. A mass of fig, honeycomb, lemon rind and pith, it has wonderful focus, balance, length and concentration.
title: L'Ecole No. 41 2012 Klipsun Vineyard Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

description: This 100% Cab wants some time in the cellar. Right now, it's fresh and powerful in black cherries, currants, licorice, mocha and sweet toasty oak, with firm tannins and a streak of citrusy acidity. A masculine wine, brooding and aloof, it needs at least 6–8 years in a good cellar to begin to come around.
title: Malk 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: A well-balanced wine, showing good acidity and honeyed ripeness in equal measure. With its pure line of bright acidity and dried apricot flavors, it's a wine that has a promising future. Drink from 2016.
title: Angerhof Tschida 2010 Beerenauslese Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

description: This great Amarone has earthy aromas of tilled soil, iris, tobacco and exotic spices. The palate shows delicious raspberry and raisin flavors, with accents of nutmeg, licorice and black pepper, delivered in a fresh and restrained style.
title: Antolini 2009 Moropio  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Dry and crisp with acidity, this Sauvignon Blanc, with 3% Sémillon, was fermented in stainless steel but partially aged in neutral oak barrels. The palate shows complex flavors of citrus fruits, Asian pears, lychee, cashews, vanilla, minerals and white pepper, with a touch of honey. The grapes come from all around the valley, including the cooler Oak Knoll district as well as warmer St. Helena. A brilliant example of blending, and easy to find, with 10,000 cases produced.
title: Atalon 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: An intoxicatingly sensual Grenache, velvety and light in cherry and strawberry fruit, smooth earth, a streak of anise and deep swirls of chocolate and caramel on the finish. The Dalton Vineyard in Calaveras County has been one to watch for in Syrah and Zinfandel; it can now add Grenache.
title: Calavera Wines 2011 Dalton Vineyard Grenache (Calaveras County)

description: What stands out about Confluence most is its wealth of plush mushroom and woodsy earth accenting the otherwise rich, ripe, black cherry flavor. Powerful, it offers Anderson Valley's nuances, a dash of spice and bright acidity.
title: Goldeneye 2010 Confluence Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: From a cool site, The Narrows is rich in ripe, dark cherry and a touch of herb, offering concentrated and intense flavors, with plenty of acidity to pair alongside a dish like roast pork tenderloin with rosemary or Quiche Lorraine.
title: Goldeneye 2010 The Narrows Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: After initial aromas of char, gritty leather, asphalt and tar fade, you get mature, herbal cherry and plum scents. This gran reserva is delivering light, racy, tangy flavors of raspberry and strawberry along with vanilla. On the finish, this is subtle, elegant and pure. Drink now through 2024.
title: CVNE 2004 Imperial Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Chris Gorman is the winemaker for this pure, old vine Cabernet Sauvignon. It is a full force gale of a wine, sappy and dense, with blackberry and cassis fruit wreathed in smoke and dark accents from aging in 100% new French oak. Young, big and bold, it remains poised and balanced, with juicy acidity keeping all the flavors in proportion.
designation: Collaboration Series V Ciel du Cheval Vineyard
title: Force Majeure 2010 Collaboration Series V Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: There's a severity of acids and tannins that limits this Pinot's immediate enjoyment. It feels tight and hard, despite a core of black and red cherries and the sweetness of toasty oak. All indications point to the cellar. Give it 6–7 years, and it could be going strong well after 2020.
title: Foxen 2011 Block 8 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Château de Mercuès has had its own vineyard since the 13th century. This latest vintage is a powerful wine, pure tannic and rich Malbec, structured and with huge black fruits. The wine has weight, solid tannins and an excellent potential. Drink from 2017–2018.
title: Georges Vigouroux 2010 Château de Mercuès Malbec (Cahors)

description: Roasted, gritty aromas of bacon and spicy oak are burnt on the surface. This is fleshy and full in body, with moderate acidity. Herbal, minty, lightly green berry flavors have a rooty accent and oaky makeup. Finishing flavors of mint and raw oak blend into herbal berry leftovers.
title: Valentin Bianchi 2014 Famiglia Bianchi Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Nectarine, apricot and botrytis aromas are sound but familiar. Round, full but not quite sticky, this tastes like toffee, honey and pear, with baking spice flavors, nutmeg in particular, on the finish.
designation: Toro de Piedra Grand Reserve Late Harvest
title: Viña Requingua 2013 Toro de Piedra Grand Reserve Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Curicó Valley)

description: Sultry vanilla, smoke and bergamot notes thread languorously on the nose of this intensely perfumed Chardonnay. The palate is more subdued, showing zesty red apple and lemon anchored by a crisp acidic backbone. It's a touch woody now but could balance out with a few more years of bottle aging.
title: Whitecliff Vineyard 2014 Reserve Chardonnay (Hudson River Region)

description: Deep ruby in the glass, this wine offers a bouquet of cassis and strawberry. It is bright at first sip, but chalky tannins quickly make their presence known amidst flavors of black cherry, anise and juniper berry that come to a head in a pleasantly bitter apple-peel finish.
title: Wine Man 2014 Mukuzani Saperavi (Kakheti)

description: Yealands is based in the Awatere Valley, a subregion of Marlborough that offers generally cooler, later ripening than the main (Wairau) valley. This is a fresh, sappy, medium-bodied Pinot Noir, featuring notes of cherry, vanilla and herb. It should provide easy quaffing over the next few years.
title: Yealands 2014 Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Awatere Valley)

description: Aromas of oak, mint and cola accent earthy black-fruit scents in front of a palate that's tannic and raw but firm and structured. Berry and salty, oaky flavors finish with grabby, drying tannins and peppery spice.
title: Zuccardi 2014 Q Malbec (Valle de Uco)

description: This golden Chardonnay is loaded with rich, oaky aromas of corn pudding, butterscotch, baked apple and wood grain. Plump and soft on the palate, this tastes of baked apple, creamed corn and buttery oak, with popcorn to the finish. Drink through 2017.
title: El Enemigo 2015 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Named after the church which is next to the Brocard winery, this crisp fruity wine is lively with acidity, lemon and apple fruits and a light tangy texture. The wine becomes more ripe as it opens up showing peach and apricot flavors at the end. Drink now.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2015 Sainte-Claire  (Chablis)

description: Produced from vineyards in the hills above the Côte de Nuits, this wine benefits from the ripe vintage of 2015. It has open red fruit and soft tannins that are both lifted by the acidity. Made to be drunk young, this is ready to enjoy now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: This sweet red wine made from Cabernet Sauvignon has aromas of blackberry and dark chocolate that lead to flavors of dried plum, honey and black raspberry in the mouth. There is enough acidity to prevent the wine from being cloying and to allow the sweet finish to prevail.
title: Lion-Gri 2011 Kagor Special Pastoral Cabernet Sauvignon (Moldova)

description: This bottling is easy, light and crisp, starting with squeezed orange and ripe yellow apples on the nose. It's delicate on the palate, with citrus and stone-fruit flavors, just right for an afternoon sip in the sun.
title: Maddalena 2015 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)

description: Baking spice, freshly hewn wood and dark fruit aromas are followed by pitch-black-fruit flavors. The volatiles are just in check.
title: Maryhill 2013 Clifton Hill Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Wahluke Slope)

description: This wine gets a bonus for venturing into new territory, aging Cab in used Bourbon barrels. The result is far from perfect, but not as gimmicky as one might assume. Aromas of leathery blackberry, cedar, roasted pasilla chile and tons of caramel lead into flavors of cocoa, coconut and caramel on the creamy, peppery palate.
designation: Private Selection Aged in Bourbon Barrels
title: Robert Mondavi 2014 Private Selection Aged in Bourbon Barrels Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey County)

description: A blend of Gamay and Pinot Noir, this wine has qualities from both grapes. It has the bright cherry flavors of the Gamay and the rich, red-berry fruits of the Pinot Noir. They are finely integrated into this soft ripe wine that is ready to drink.
title: Roche de Bellene 2014 Cuvée Terroir  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: This hearty red has aromas of scorched earth, dry forest floor, French oak and grilled herb. The robust palate shows the heat of the vintage, offering raisin, toasted oak, licorice and clove alongside dusty drying tannins and modest acidity.
title: Tenute Fiorebelli 2011 Coste Bianche  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Citrusy aromas suggest white grapefruit. Plump but balanced in feel, this tastes a bit salty and briny, maybe a reflection of its partial coastal grapes, something that's new to Argentina. The briny tangy finish is interesting.
title: Trapiche 2016 Costa & Pampa Sauvignon Blanc (Buenos Aires)

description: Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon make up most of this blend. Aromas of vanilla, spice and red and black fruit lead to soft-feeling fruit and barrel flavors that put a focus on elegance.
title: Columbia Winery 2013 Element Red (Wahluke Slope)

description: The name of this bottling, which included 6% Petite Sirah, implies youth, but a bit more age might be helpful for this rustic grape. Juicy and smoky aromas of ground coffee, blueberry, fudge and gravel show on the nose, while the palate presents tight raspberry, caramel and brisk oak flavors. It's interesting, though a tad thin.
title: Croma Vera 2015 Joven Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

description: The wine is soft and creamy. Made from fruit grown in the Mâcon region, it is ripe and with a good balance between citrus and melon flavors. The acidity and the attractive fruitiness have produced a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de la Denante 2015  Bourgogne

description: The Sacy is a rare variety found only in a corner of the Yonne Valley west of Chablis and in the small Loire appellation of Saint-Pourçain where it is known as Tressallier. This is a spicy wine with plenty of acidity and a crisp texture. It is fruity with green plum and a brilliant, fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine Gueguen 2015 Cuvée Confidentielle  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: This is a fresh, fruity and apple-crisp wine that is light, buoyant with acidity and shot with citrus. It is lightly mineral, textured and with attractive crispness at the end. The Devillard family bottles this wine on behalf the estate's owners. Drink now.
title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Domaine de la Garenne  (Mâcon-Azé)

description: Deliciously light and herbal, this smooth, creamy wine is bright, poised with black-currant fruits and ripe gooseberry flavors. Drink this wine young, for its great fruit.
title: Fournier Père et Fils 2015 Côtes de Morogues  (Menetou-Salon)

description: Savory whiffs of nut skins, earth and sweat juxtapose sweet grapefruit and peach in this slightly rustic Riesling. Delicately textured with a lacy veil of sweetness, it's balanced briskly by a core of lime acidity. The finish is long and meandering.
title: Fox Run 2012 Riesling 11 Hanging Delta Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Aromas of honey-glazed tangerines, lemons and limes abound on this spry, light-footed Riesling, but there's a savory element of nuts and smoke that persists from nose to finish as well. The palate is moderately sweet yet balanced keenly with acidity. The finish is brisk and clean.
title: Fox Run 2012 Riesling 12 Lake Dana Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Pure fruitiness holds the balance of this wine between crisp acidity and a tightly mineral texture. It comes from the producer's Bué vineyards, one of the top villages of Sancerre. The wine is crisp, made to be drunk young and fruity.
title: François Millet 2015 Domaine des Côtes Blanches  (Sancerre)

description: This is delicately herbal, with green notes similar to snow peas gracing nectarine and grapefruit flavors. A bit of pineapple creeps in on the abbreviated finish.
title: Giesen 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: The apple and cider aromas are vibrant while the palate offers plenty of dry tart fruit flavors. It brings appeal.
title: Karma Vineyards 2011 Brut de Brut Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Ripe, leaning to almost overripe, green and yellow-apple aromas lead to cidery flavors. Tart acidity backs it all up.
title: Karma Vineyards 2011 Brut Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Pale pink in color, this wine offers aromas of herb, yeast, and overripe red apple. The apple-skin flavors are dry with tart acidity.
title: Karma Vineyards 2012 Pink Bubbly Méthode Traditionnelle Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Malbec makes up 73% of this blend, with 17% Cabernet Sauvignon, 8% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Franc. Dried herb and cedar give it an herbaceous character. Soft, moderate acidity provides a backbone against larger-sized tannins and a touch of bitter tobacco.
title: Lasseter 2012 Amoureux Estate Grown Red (Sonoma Valley)

description: 92-94 Dark tannins and structure go with the most powerful fruit. Full of ripe berries, this has all the structure and density. The acidity helps it on its way.
title: Château Pontac-Lynch 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 92-94 Very rich in character. The sweetness is there, but masked by the firm structure, the almost tannic texture. Great concentration.
title: Château Rabaud-Promis 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 92-94 Concentrated tannins, very rich, very firm, very dry at this stage. There is a more juicy character underneath, offering the potential of rich berry fruits. There's a new wood, smoky aftertaste.
title: Château Haut Bages Libéral 2010 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: 92-94 Ripe, juicy aromas, a wine that then offers sweet fruit, great flavors, a ripe wine with blackberry flavors and balanced tannins.
title: Château la Dominique 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92-94 Big and tannic, very firm and tough. Yet all the fruit is there, offering great potential. There is a ripe, juicy aftertaste. Under the same ownership as Château Léoville-Poyferré in Saint-Julien.
title: Château Le Crock 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 92-94 Sweet and juicy, a wine that has the potential to be delicious. The tannins are certainly prominent, although with good sweetness. Finally very structured.
title: Château Malescot Saint-Exupery 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 92-94 Powerful, very juicy in style, with toasty new wood flavors mingling with the the very ripe fruits. The wine has a bitter, extracted edge that will probably soften with further wood aging.
title: Château Beausejour-Duffau-Lagarrosse 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92-94 New, polished wood aromas lead to a wine that has a smooth balance between toast, sweet fruits and a velvet-textured acidity. Delicious.
title: Château Brane-Cantenac 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 92-94 Juicy black fruits, very ripe berries, powered by the darkest tannins. The wine has richness, weight and immense structure.
title: Château Croizet-Bages 2010 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: 92-94 Herbaceous style of wine, a Bordeaux white wine classic style, with crisp grassy Sauvignon Blanc flavors, elegant, not heavy.
title: Château de France 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 92-94 A closed up wine, although all the elements are there, promising great final balance, richness and power.
title: Château Guiraud 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 92-94 Smoky wine, dominated by its dry tannins, seemingly extracted. The wine certainly has weight and power, but the dryness is a major element at this stage. It will need serious aging time.
title: Château Bélair-Monange 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92-94 Powerful tannins here, spiced with a considerable amount of new wood. The wine has richness, black chocolate burnt toast flavors along with intense sweet plum fruits.
designation: Barrel sample Les Pagodes de Cos
title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2010 Barrel sample Les Pagodes de Cos  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 92-94 Packed with tannins, new wood and a dense character, this is going to be a wine for the long-term. It has all the power, although with a softer side in the final fruitiness.
title: Château d'Arsac 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 92-94 There is power and richness here, the wine has weight, delicious ripe fruits and a smooth texture. Under that surface is the powerful, dense texture.
title: Château Ferrière 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 92-94 A hugely fruity wine, very rich, concentrated and dense. It has great power and richness, the berry fruits racing with ripeness.
title: Château Fonbadet 2010 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: 92-94 Big, firm, with dense tannins that underly the ripe, dark berry and plum skin fruit flavors. Very powerful, the almost shocking acidity a cutting edge of freshness. Hugely juicy aftertaste.
title: Château la Pointe 2010 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)

description: 92-94 Dark, dry wine initially with austerity. Then the bright berry fruits come from behind the severe façade to give a structured, still luscious wine.
title: Château Lagrange 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 92-94 A rich and firm wine, packed with dark tannins, wood flavors, very concentrated and dense. The sweet, smoky character comes through to give opulent black fruits.
title: Château Lynch-Moussas 2010 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: 92-94 Ripe blackcurrants, powerful fruit, with great acidity and enticing dusty tannins. The wine brings out juicy Merlot flavors, with a more concentrated element.
designation: Barrel sample Alter Ego de Château Palmer
title: Château Palmer 2010 Barrel sample Alter Ego de Château Palmer  (Margaux)

description: 92-94 Very structured wine, its fruit tannins dominant. It has power and extreme concentration. Dark and dense.
title: Château Siran 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 92-94 Spice, smoky fruit, with great acidity, a wine that offers richness, structure, powerful tannins and already some delicious blackberry fruits.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 92-94 A luxurious wine, acidity and sweet plum fruits rolling together into a fine, beautiful structure. It has toughness, to be sure, while it is the glamorous surface that is immediately attractive.
title: Château Talbot 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 92-94 This is rounded, ripe, a densely tannic mineral wine, very intense. It is tense, structured, firm, promising long aging.
title: Les Astéries 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92-94 With huge tannins, very dark fruits, powerful and concentrated. The wine is ripe, juicy and firmly tannic.
title: Château Certan de May de Certan 2010 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)
winery: Château Certan de May de Certan

description: 92-94 Great dusty tannins, almost too powerful, very solid in character. The wine is chunky, allowing juicy fruits to show. It is a dry wine, certainly not hard.
title: Château Cheval Blanc 2010 Barrel sample Le Petit Cheval  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92-94 Great acidity here, the wine has freshness as well as dried apricot and peach flavors, very honeyed. Excellent acidity to finish.
title: Château de Malle 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 92-94 Hugely aromatic, a wine that manages to combine freshness, lightness and density. It is deliciously fresh, then offering a fine, ripe dried fruit aftertaste.
title: Château de Myrat 2010 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 92-94 Spice and mint aromas with blackberry fruit, new wood and a polished character. The acidity is delicious, refreshing.
title: Château Faugères 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92-94 Sweetly juicy wine, the new wood giving high toast to the black currant flavors. It is on the elegant side, although the new wood needs to be tamed to let the fruit come through.
title: Château Giscours 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: Spiced plum, truffle, new leather, coconut and oak aromas lead the nose. Taut and tightly wound, the palate offers dried cherry, tart cranberry, espresso, anise and sage notes. Give the tannins another few years to unwind then drink to capture the remaining fruit.
title: La Rasina 2012  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Small production (one barrel!) single-vineyard Pinots are challenging, as there is no wiggle room via blending. This comes out crisp and focused, with light cherry fruit and ample flavors of tea, herb and leaf.
title: Love & Squalor 2014 Sunny Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Vanilla, baked cherry and coconut aromas lead the nose. Bright and tense, the palate offers Marasca cherry, raspberry, vanilla and clove flavors, bolstered by firm acidity and youthfully austere tannins that leave a grippy finish. It needs to unwind and soften.
title: Lunadoro 2013 Pagliareto  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Tilled soil, blue flower and Mediterranean herb aromas follow through to the young, tightly wound palate. Juicy dark-skinned berry flavor is supported by taut, fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2018.
title: Avignonesi 2015  Rosso di Montepulciano

description: Made entirely from Sangiovese, this opens with delicate black-skinned fruit and baking spice aromas. The straightforward palate delivers black cherry jam, cooking spice and white pepper flavors, rounded with ripe tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Badia di Morrona 2011 Vigna Alta Sangiovese (Toscana)

description: Spicy reedy cherry and red-plum aromas open this high-acid sizzler from a cool vintage. Lean as a stick in terms of build, this tastes of raspberry, red plum and dry spices. A short but juicy and tight finish is ripping with acid. Drink through 2025.
title: Basagoiti 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)

description: Due to the cold, wet vintage, the estate made no Brunello in 2014; its best grapes went into this wine. It shows the house's hallmark elegance and is delicately scented with bright red berry and violet aromas that carry over to the ethereal palate, accented by a white pepper note. Racy acidity and tight, fine tannins provide the framework. Drink 2018–2024.
title: Biondi Santi 2014 Fascia Rossa  (Rosso di Montalcino)

description: Potent oaky aromas like nutmeg, cinnamon and toasted baguette meet abundant, jammy fruit flavors in this full-bodied and smooth-textured wine. It has moderate tannins that provide nice grip and shore up the oak and fruit components for balance.
title: Brazin 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

description: This blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Cabernet Franc, 10% Merlot and 10% Sangiovese opens with aromas recalling blackberry, cedar and Mediterranean herb. The savory, medium-bodied palate delivers ripe black cherry, mocha and black pepper notes with firm tanninc underpinnings. Drink through 2019.
title: Grattamacco 2015 Rosso  (Bolgheri)

description: Earthy with subtle Asian spice and forest floor scents, this wine is medium in build and generous in tannin, still untangling its limbs in the glass.
title: Hawley 2014 Oehlman Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is pungent, showing some sweaty, boxwood notes alongside lemony citrus fruit. It's light on its feet, with moderately intense lemon flavors that fade on the finish. Drink now.
title: Howard Park 2016 Miamup Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

description: Black cherry, underbrush and tilled soil aromas lead the nose of this blend of 70% Sangiovese, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot. The polished yet firmly tannic palate delivers dark plum, cake spice and white pepper flavors. Enjoy through 2019.
title: Il Sassolo 2013 Santa Cristina a Mezzana  (Carmignano)

description: This is indicated as a reserve-level selection, but at the moment remains unfocused, and even a bit dilute. Tart fruits and tight tannins never quite fit together. The drying finish carries a hint of wet cement. Give this at least another year or two of bottle age.
title: Carabella 2014 Inchinnan Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Subtle plum, toast, underbrush and violet aromas slowly emerge in this Riserva. The firm palate offers black currant, sour cherry, dried sage and espresso, while taut, close-grained tannins leave an assertive finish. Drink 2018–2023.
title: Carpineto 2012 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Jammy fruit aromas and flavors and a lack of overt oak notes make this full-bodied wine easy to love. It's simply yummy in flavor, polished in texture, and has a nice, lingering ripe fruit finish.
title: Château Souverain 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this opens with black cherry and cinnamon aromas that carry over to the straightforward, balsamic-seeming palate. Polished tannins provide support. Drink through 2020.
title: Ciacci Piccolomini d'Aragona 2013 Ateo Red (Sant'Antimo)

description: This opens with violet, red berry and leather aromas. The savory, straightforward palate offers ripe red cherry, raspberry and clove notes, with a hint of sage and fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2020.
title: Citille di Sopra 2015  Rosso di Montalcino

description: Delicate wild berry, underbrush, clove and grilled herb scents waft from the glass. The palate is ethereal and light-bodied, offering red cherry, pomegranate, and cinnamon flavors with a touch of game. Tangy acidity and supple tannins make it approachable now. Drink through 2020.
title: Crocedimezzo 2012  Brunello di Montalcino

description: The nose of this bottling from a stone-strewn vineyard in the heart of the appellation is very restrained, offering wet concrete, lime and lemon pith scents, with a touch of sweet chive. Pink grapefruit and petrol notes show on the palate, which is layered with an intriguingly sticky texture.
title: De Tierra 2015 Zabala Vineyard Riesling (Arroyo Seco)

description: Stewed prune, espresso, and menthol aromas lead the nose, along with a whiff of leather. The warm, robust palate offers raisin, clove and licorice flavors, while fine-grained tannins provide support. Drink through 2019.
title: Dei 2011 Bossona Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: The nose is very shy: a mere hint of earthiness emanates. The slender palate shows very clean fruit of yellow apple residing on a slender lemony palate. This is fresh and sprightly with a dry finish. Drink soon.
title: Domaine Charles Baur 2015 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

description: A blend of 80% Sangiovese, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Canaiolo, this opens with delicate blackberry and violet aromas. The palate delivers wild cherry, cedar and star anise flavors, braced by firm tannins. Enjoy through 2020.
title: Fattoria La Vialla 2013 Casa Conforto Riserva  (Chianti)

description: A blend of 90% Sangiovese, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot, this opens with violet and baking spice aromas. The dense palate delivers ripe black cherry, clove and cocoa flavors, with grippy tannins. Enjoy through 2020.
title: Canonica a Cerreto 2011 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: Australia used to make more blends like this, using the acids of Semillon to balance the ripeness of Chardonnay. In this case, they come together to offer toasty, honeyed notes backed by a strong lemony spine. It's crisp and tart on the finish at first, then relaxes rapidly with airing, so drink it over the next year or so.
title: Maverick 2012 Breechens Chardonnay-Semillon (Barossa)

description: A dark color and chunky aromas of black plum and animal hide set up a full tannic, rubbery palate. Herbal salty notes accent core plum and berry flavors, while this is long on the finish, with earthy notes and a sauvage hint of garrigue.
title: Portal del Priorat 2013 Gotes del Priorat Carignan-Grenache (Priorat)

description: This wine is teeming with black fruit, cassis and sage. The palate is a complex and evolving accomplishment—bright black cherry and sage meld with earthy notes of cedar and tobacco, all framed by structured tannins. The finish is long and woody.
title: Stinson 2013 Meritage Red (Monticello)

description: This Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot blend opens with black-skinned fruit and incense aromas. The palate is straightforward, delivering black plum and vanilla flavors with a hint of leather. Round tannins provide laid-back support. Enjoy through 2019.
title: Tringali Casanuova 2013 1698  (Bolgheri)

description: Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot come together to offer black currant and vanilla aromas in this dense Bolgheri red. The palate doles out ripe black plum and cedar-inflected tobacco flavors, set against fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2020.
title: Tringali Casanuova 2013 Renzo  (Bolgheri)

description: Violet, dark-skinned berry and balsamic notes come together in this ripe, round wine. The palate delivers black cherry, tobacco and thyme flavors, bolstered by assertive tannins. Enjoy 2018–2023.
title: Villa Le Prata 2012  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Delicate yet beguiling, with aromas of violets, ripe pomegranates and granite, there's an Old World elegance that sets this Romanian Pinot Noir apart. The palate is concentrated, with crisp red cherry and plum flavors, but keenly balanced by brisk acidity and soft, finely-grained tannins. Structured and refined with a medium long finish.
title: Cramele Halewood 2009 Kronos Limited Edition Pinot Noir (Dealu Mare)

description: Darcie Kent really nails this Cab out of John Madden's Ranch. Pungently bold and moody, intensely herbal with green pepper and olive, wrapped within a wall of black pepper that lingers. Pair it with pepper steak.
title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2008 Madden Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

description: While it does have the structure of a Pommard, this is also a ripe, rounded wine. Its sweet red fruits surround the firm tannins offering richness. A wine that will offer sold pleasure in 3–4 years.
title: Domaine Moillard 2009 Rugiens Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: A beautifully perfumed wine that shows some of the structure of a Gevrey but combines this with dark rich fruits and sweet tannins. There is a smoky flavor that balances the ripe red fruits and final acidity.
title: Domaine Thierry Mortet 2009  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: An interesting blend of equal parts Syrah and Mourvèdre wiith 8% Tannat, The Pepper Pot offers concentrated aromas and flavors of dark forest berries and fleshy black plums. A hint of leather and game unfolds on the finish, while medium acidity keeps the flavors fresh on the palate.
title: Edgebaston 2010 The Pepper Pot Red (Stellenbosch)

description: There's so much nuance and complexity in this rustic yet fascinating Croatian wine, that it takes a while to break down its components. Initial scents of dried leaves and mulch blow off to reveal an array of delicate floral and fruit aromas, accented by rich chocolate and vanilla notes. Big in both alcohol and structure, its massively tannic, but smoothes out with aeration. Decant to drink now, but could easily evolve for 5–10 years.
title: Saints Hills 2009 Dinga Plavac Mali (Peljesac)

description: A classic Brunello with a savory, aged quality that exudes sophistication and elegance. Dried fruit, cassis, spice, old leather and rum cake form the bouquet. The wine is finely textured, sharp and clean in the mouth. Seems aged, savory and austere.
title: SassodiSole 2007  Brunello di Montalcino

description: From the Castello di Argiano property, Sesti's delicious Rosso has bright aromas of small berry, dried rosemary, dark chocolate and toasted almond.
title: Sesti 2010  Rosso di Montalcino

description: A brilliant gold color, this Chenin boasts wood-infused fruit notes of pear, peach pit and melon alongside accents of honeysuckle and toasted brioche. The round, slightly slick mouthfeel is elevated with a mouthwatering acidic cut to the close.
title: Spice Route 2009 Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

description: Solidly varietal flavors of strawberry and Bing cherry fruit anchor this well-made, 100% Barbera. The wine has both depth and polish, with some varietal tartness running through a medium length finish. It makes a good case for Barbera's potential in Washington state.
title: Stottle 2008 Barbera (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A tremendous wine. Made from 100% Cabernet and raised for nearly two years in 40% new French oak, it defines the ripe, hedonistic Napa style. Yet it's no mere fruit bomb, offering a tobaccoey earthiness to the berries. A touch of raisins and heat in the finish seems to limit ageability, though, so drink up.
title: Venge 2009 Silencieux Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Blackberry aromas blend with open-grained oak to create a slightly charred bouquet. A bit acidic and edgy in feel, with a mix of herb, plum and berry flavors. Tight, juicy and a touch short on the finish, with dry, peppery spice notes. Drink now through 2014.
title: Viña Vilano 2009 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

description: This 60-40 blend combines Shiraz's blackberry fruit with Cab's slightly herbal notes to make a pretty marriage. It shows enough firmness to stand up to rich, fatty meats now, or to sustain it through up to a decade of cellaring.
title: Inkberry 2009 Mountain Estate Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Ranges)

description: This wine strikes a nice balance between sweet and savory spice on the nose, with ripe fruit, prune and leather in the background. This is a velvety, warm, earthy wine with a broad aromatic delivery and bold Brunello style. It's smooth and round, without any of the sharp acidic accents you sometimes find in Sangiovese Grosso.
title: La Colombina 2007  Brunello di Montalcino

description: This Brunello shows elegant aromatic restraint in its tight aromas of wild berry and red currant. Dark flavors of barbecue spice, cured meat, leather and tobacco layer the midpalate, then turn fine and full on the finish.
title: Le Gode 2007  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Dusty dark cherry and blackberry fruit dominate the nose, with secondary aromas of game, peppery spice and tobacco. The dark fruit character continues on the palate, transitioning into the finish, which is laced with hints of mocha and spice. Medium weight, with nice vibrancy in the mouth. Drink now-2015.
title: Lions Drift 2009 Silkbush Mountain Vineyards Pinotage (Breedekloof)

description: Pretty to sniff, with aromas of lemon, fresh white fruits and minerals. Feels crisp, chiseled and racy, with blazing acidity propelling green apple, lime, green melon and saline flavors. Long on the finish. Drink now.
title: Pazo de Barrantes 2010 Pazo Barrantes Albariño (Rías Baixas)

description: This Brunello shows aromas of leather and cured meat without much fresh fruit to hold it up. The structure and acidity is there, along with tertiary aromas of crushed mineral, asphalt, candied fruit and dried sage.
title: Podere La Vigna 2006 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: This pretty Rosso di Montalcino opens with a concentrated appearance and aromas of ripe fruit, spice, toasted nut and dried rosemary. A bit thin on the finish, the wine concludes with silky tannins and a fresh touch.
title: Poggio Nardone 2009  Rosso di Montalcino

description: Lemon verbena and green grass aromas waft from the glass, with secondary notes of grapefruit and stone fruit to round it out. Vibrant acidity brightens this medium-weight mouth, with a touch of green plum-skin flavor and soft bitterness remaining through the lively finish.
title: Morgenhof 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Simonsberg-Stellenbosch)

description: Spice and cream combine in a rounded, soft, very ripe wine. It has intense flavors of lychee and white peach with a refreshing amount of acidity. The wine is dry, but rich from the ginger and with a peppery final bite.
title: Pierre Sparr 2010 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

description: Nice and peppery, with deep, impressive blackberry and plum, bacon and sandalwood flavors. It's a full-bodied wine with lots of power and elegance. Drink now.
title: Q 2010 Syrah (Sonoma County)

description: Extra brut means that this Pinot Noir-based bubbly is drier than Schramsberg's regular brut. Even at the age of more than seven years, it's aggressive in bubbly acidity, with a scoury mouthfeel framing ripe raspberry and lime flavors. Feels austere and hard, but who knows? Could surprise. A gamble if you want to cellar it.
title: Schramsberg 2004 Extra Brut Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Forward aromas of sweet spice and baked apple lead the nose, while secondary hints of cobbler and vanilla cream follow. The palate is lush and ripe, but it's kept in check by a streak of acidity that braces up the nutty finish. Rich, balanced and accessible.
title: Thelema 2009 Sutherland Chardonnay (Elgin)

description: Here's a tight, streamlined Brunello characterized by a toasted or charred almond note and bright forest notes of wild berry and underbrush. The mouthfeel is lean and tight, and there's a tannic firmness that holds it together.
title: Collosorbo 2007  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Excellent growing conditions and quality fruit shape this fresh, food wine that pairs well with pasta or meat dish. The bouquet is redolent of black cherry, plum, chocolate mocha and spice.
title: Fattoria La Lecciaia 2010  Rosso di Montalcino

description: A big, warm style of Chard. The nose is soft, toasty and loaded with butter, baked apple and vanilla aromas. Feels full, round and creamy, while oak sits at the forefront of the flavor profile, with toast, apple and vanilla lurking behind. Finishes sweet and smooth. 400 cases made.
title: Viña Cobos 2010 Bramare Marchiori Vineyard Chardonnay (Perdriel)

description: A delicate and subtle expression of Sangiovese Grosso, with tight touches of wild berry, almond skin, forest bramble, rum cake, cola and eucalyptus. Streamlined and tight, with great power on the close. A very compact and tightly constructed wine.
title: Agostina Pieri 2007  Brunello di Montalcino

description: This young winery has made huge strides with its red wines, as this 100% Cabernet Sauvignon demonstrates. Young, tight, tart, and expressive, it takes the cranberry and cassis components from cool-vintage, cool-climate grapes, and turns them into a complete and complex wine. High acid, with well-integrated nuances of mushroom, earth, and smoke.
title: Airfield Estates 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

description: The wine is subdued and clean on the nose and it doesn't exaggerate or mask the quality of fruit. This is executed in a bright, compact and streamlined style that combines freshness and firmness.
title: Baricci 2007  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Flashy notes of wood-grilled apple, brioche and apricot fill the nose. The mouth is round and the palate spicy, as flavors of ginger and cedar dominate the stone fruit.
title: Radford Dale 2009 Viognier (Stellenbosch)

description: Overworked and oaky, with vanilla, buttered toast and sweet caramel flavors dominating everything else. Buried beneath are pineapple and pear flavors.
title: Rodney Strong 2009 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Very ripe and flashy, but a little too sweet. Shows sugary raspberry and cherry jam flavors, with lots of zippy acidity.
title: Rusack 2009 Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This Tuscan rosé made using Sangiovese grapes opens with a pink-purplish color and bright aromas of rose, cranberry and wild forest berry. There's a pretty touch of bitter almond on the close.
title: Salcheto 2009 Rosé (Toscana)

description: A touch of oak adds some creaminess, but this 100% Sauvignon Blanc is marked mainly by fresh fruit flavors of lemons, limes and oranges. It's zesty in acidity, but could be a little drier.
title: Sea Fog 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Opens with aromas of black cherry and waves of resiny oak. Has good body and grabby barrel tannins along with a palate that deals dark berry flavor and even more oakiness. Tastes resiny and saucy on the finish; cleans up as it airs.
title: Sur de los Andes 2009 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

description: This bright Moscato d'Asti opens with full, generous tones of peach, honey, acacia blossom, jasmine and freshly peeled tangerine skin. The rich and foamy mouthfeel would pair with soft cheese on dry rye crackers.
title: Tenimenti Ca' Bianca 2011  Moscato d'Asti

description: This dark Rosso opens with aromas of dark fruit and bramble, with subtle background hints of wild mushroom and cured meat. Endnotes of crushed black pepper and crushed clove bring up the rear.
title: Tenuta Carlina 2010 La Togata  (Rosso di Montalcino)

description: Reale (100% Merlot) offers sweet cherry and raspberry aromas with light touches of spice and toasted almond in the background. This ruby colored wine offers an easy, fresh and lean feel in the mouth.
title: Fattoria la Castellina 2008 Reale Merlot (Toscana)

description: A fresh wine with red cherry fruits giving a bright character, the tannins soft and with attractive acidity. It is lightly textured and should be ready to drink in 1–2 years.
title: Domaine Moillard 2009  Côte de Nuits-Villages

description: The easy-to-find Gnarly Head, a blend of 50% Zinfandel, 20% Merlot, 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Petite Sirah and 3% Syrah, is young and ready to drink.Its fruity nose and peppery spice tmakes it a full-blown crowd pleaser ready for backyard barbecues.
title: Gnarly Head 2010 Authentic Red Red (Lodi)

description: Exotic and unusual for value-priced Malbec, with aromas of blueberry and Middle Eastern spice. Feels chunky yet juicy, with good acidity highlighting lightly herbal flavors of plum and tomato. Meaty, round and solid on the finish, with saucy spiciness.
title: Rio Perdido 2010 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Smells sort of furry and earthy initially, with notes of graphite and woodspice. Feels narrow and grabby, with pointed acididty framing red plum, cherry and lightly oaky, minty flavors. Fits the definition of good but regular Malbec.
title: Ruca Malen 2009 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

description: This fresh expression of Sangiovese Grosso offers tight berry aromas, with shades of spice and toasted almond in the background. Bright acidity brings up the rear.
title: San Polo 2008  Rosso di Montalcino

description: Light bodied and modest in flavor, with lots of acidity. You find yourself wishing there was more in the way of fruit. Still, it's pretty good for the price, with a nice, silky texture.
title: Sebastiani 2010 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: From a well-regarded site in the Horse Heaven Hills, this pure Malbec is clean and well-proportioned, but a bit on the simple side. Plain red fruit flavors, accented with light barrel notes, quickly fade on the delicate finish.
title: Smasne Cellars 2008 Phinny Hill Vineyard Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Coconut, vanilla and dill aromas sit on top of solid berry scents to form a classic Rioja bouquet. Feels fresh and agile, with acidity that allows the wine to dance around on the palate. Tastes of red plum, raspberry, mint and spice. Seems oaky on the finish, but lively.
title: Viña Eguía 2008 Crianza  (Rioja)

description: There's something off in the aroma, which is herbal and peppery. Turns richer once you take a sip, with pleasantly dry, crisp cherry candy, white pepper and oak flavors. The vineyard is in a cool site, and it tastes like the grapes were not fully ripe. A disappointment after so many great bottlings from MacRostie.
title: MacRostie 2008 Wildcat Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: A little fiery and forced on the nose, but its wild berry and charred aromas it's solid. Feels full and stacked, with plum, cassis, pepper and a mild green element. Smooth in feel on the finish, but herbal tasting.
title: Maipe 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Fair Play-based Perry Creek's Cab has high toned blue and red fruit and is tamely structured for being from high-elevation vineyards. Its finish is sweetly floral.
title: Perry Creek 2008 Altitude: 2401 Cabernet Sauvignon (El Dorado)

description: The vineyard is in Coombsville, a cool part of the valley that recently received official recognition as an AVA. The wine, which was made from 100% Cabernet, is soft, sweet and oaky, showing simple blackberry, cherry and anise flavors.
title: Hesperian 2007 Harry's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This is a typical blend in Gaillac, combining the broad character of the Loin de l'Oeil with the crisper Sauvignon. It's a fine, ripe wine that is perfumed with white stone fruit and touches of apricot. The wine's full in the mouth although lightly textured. Drink now.
title: Georges Vigouroux 2014 Gouleyant White (Gaillac)

description: Aromas of violet, wild red berry and dark cooking spice lift out of the glass. The aromas carry over to the soft, straightforward palate accompanied by mellow but rather fleeting tannins.
title: La Braccesca 2014 Sabazio  (Rosso di Montepulciano)

description: Boysenberry, cracked rainbow peppercorns and dried rose petals show on the nose of this bottling, which plays to the lighter side of the grape. It's tart and brisk once sipped, with cranberry and pomegranate fruit given more complexity by a touch of wild fennel.
title: Le Vigne 2013 Di Ranchita Vista Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

description: This slightly sweet but utterly fresh bottling shows lime zest, honey dust, ripe red apples, lemon candy and spicy jasmine on the nose. There is nearly effervescent acidity on the palate, with strong night-jasmine notes, orange blossom and lemon verbena spicing up the apple-driven fruit core.
title: Maddalena 2013 Riesling (Monterey)

description: Intriguing notes of sandalwood and cedar meet with dark red fruit and a touch of black pepper on the nose of this wine. The palate is layered with interesting touches of sage, marjoram, gravel and tar, hints of black cherry and loamy earth, and a chalky mouthfeel.
title: Martellotto 2014 La Gioja Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Aromas of oak, coconut, vanilla, espresso and charred earth come together on this structured wine. The aromas carry over to the full-bodied palate along with prune, raisin and a confectionary note. Bracing tannins clench the finish. Give the tannins a few more years to unfurl then drink to catch what remains of the fruit.
title: Ormanni 2011 Borro del Diavolo Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: Fresh and forward flavors mix rhubarb, ripe strawberries and sweet Bing cherries. This vibrant wine finishes with a refreshing snap of acidity, making it a pleasure to drink.
title: Ponzi 2015 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: The producer has the largest nursery of old grape varieties in southwest France and from it has plucked the Manseng Noir to blend with Merlot. The result is a rich wine with ripe Merlot red fruits that are given a more tannic character with the Manseng. There is a fresh juicy aftertaste that allows it to be drunk now.
title: Producteurs Plaimont 2014 Moonseng Red (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: The Arinto is a local grape as far as Lisboa is concerned, and this wine seems right at home here. Made from old vines, it is fresh, tangy and destined to be drunk young with locally-caught Atlantic Ocean fish. The wine has a pure, clean, perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2014 Arinto (Lisboa)

description: This is a clever blend with the natural ripeness of Pinot Noir in Portugal smoothing out the firmer tannins of Touriga Nacional. The result is a rich, soft wine, just lifted by acidity and anchored by a background of cherry fruits and black currant. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2014 Terra de Touros Red (Tejo)

description: The wine has plenty of fruit, the right layers of tannin. And yet it seems one-dimensional—something that can happen with Touriga Nacional. The depth and complexity found in previous vintages of this wine are missing. So you get bold black fruits and a stylish structure in a wine that is almost ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2013 Passadouro Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: This wine is all about fruit. It is dry and so fresh and crisp with apple and green pear flavors. There is a light prickle there that adds a dancing lightness to this refreshing wine.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2015 QM Terra Antiga White (Vinho Verde)

description: Fiery and borderline herbaceous aromas are green-leaning, which is surprising considering that 2011 was a warm, dry, highly regarded vintage in Rioja. On the palate, this feels strained, with outsized acidity. Herbal, roasted wild-berry flavors come with a lot of oak and clove, while the finish is fairly tart and herbal.
title: Ramón Bilbao 2011 Mirto  (Rioja)

description: An intriguing waxy character shows strongly on the nose of this bottling, with ripe lime and green-apple aromas as well. The flavors are light and delicate, with a touch of pomelo that grows with patience into more tropical yet still restrained papaya and bubblegum elements.
title: Refugio Ranch 2014 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Lean and rich at the same time, this wine offers a brightness of citrus and pear at the entry. The midpalate becomes heavier in oak and ripe in tropical flavor.
title: Saddleback 2014 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A heavy oak character controls the nose, and with it comes aromas of sawdust, vanilla, cocoa and raspberry. This feels a bit sticky and creamy, while palpable oak returns on the palate and creates vanilla, pepper and chocolate flavors. Heat, high acidity and peppery spice work the finish on this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère and Syrah.
title: Santa Luz 2013 Gran Corte Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: A perfect shade of medium pink, this is a standard, down-the-middle rose. Lemon, watermelon and fresh-cut cherry-tomato notes play on the nose, while the palate packs raspberry and Key-lime flavors.
